subject: Re: [junit] ant, junit and failure
msgSnippet: ... We have Ant experts here, but you may want to cross-post to an Ant mailing list for better service. :) ... If you get an answer somewhere else, please post
messageBody:
>So said Ostermueller, Erik on 2003-06-26 --------------------
>You all need to let me know if I'm barking up the wrong mailing list for
>this.

We have Ant experts here, but you may want to cross-post to an Ant mailing list for better service. :)

>I'm trying to get all my junit tests in a suite to run, even if there are
>one or more failures/errors.
>Afterwards, I want the build to fail if there were any failures or errors.
>
>When I added this: haltonerror="yes" haltonfailure="yes"
>to my <junit> tag in my ant file, no tests in my suite run after the first
>error/failure.
>This also forced me into using a <trycatch> to make sure my <junitreport>
>runs if there's an error failure :-(.
>If I remove these two attributes, the build doesn't fail if there were
>errors/failures.
>
>Any suggestions?

If you get an answer somewhere else, please post it here. :)
